page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: {RYE FARM _}Mr.Peter Bunting, the farmer, runs a mixed farm. He has sheep and heifers. There is one bull and a few Jacobs sheep. Wheat and barley are grown. Rats are the main pests around the barns where the animal food is stored. In one of the barns all the beams are twisted _ this was caused by the Colchester Earthquake one hundred years ago. The house at Rye Farm has a medieval moat and was originally owned by St.John's Abbey, Colchester in the 13th century. {SHEEP SHEARING AT WICK FARM_} Australian sheep shearers in action! The sheep were brought from Rye Farm to Wick Farm for a joint shearing session. They shear the sheep on boards to stop the fleece from getting soiled. They shear a sheep in only two minutes. The fleece that is sheared is sent to Oxford to be cleaned.
